title.text: Discourse Structu res for Text Generation

abstractContent.text: A bst ract Text generation programs need to be designed around a theory of text organization.
This paper introduces Rhetorical Structure Theory, a theory of text structure in which each region of text has a central nuclear part and a number of satellites related to it.
A natural text is analyzed as an example, the mechanisms of the theory are identified, and their formalization is discussed.
Ina comparison, Rhetorical Structure Theory is found to be more comprehensive and more informative about text function than the text organization parts of previous text generation systems.
